edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm

Class SSLSocketCommunicationSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm.SocketCommunicationSetup
      • edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm.SSLSocketCommunicationSetup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TwoPartyCommunicationSetup, org.apache.commons.exec.TimeoutObserver

    public class SSLSocketCommunicationSetup
extends SocketCommunicationSetup
    This class implements a communication between two parties using SSL sockets.

    It derives the SocketCommunicationSetup class since the implementation is equal except the channel type. This class creates an SSLSocketChannel while the SocketCommunicationSetup creates a PlainTCPSocketChannel.

    In order to create an sslSocket you should have an SSLContext which should be loaded with the key store and trust store. The keyStore contains the certificate that should be sent to the other party, in SCAPI the default name is "scapiKeystore". The trustStore contains the certificate that should be received from the other party, in SCAPI the default name as "scapiCacerts". This loading is done once in the constructor of this class and is passed to the SSLSocketListenerThread and to each SSLSocketChannel. This factory is used to send the certificate of this application.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SSLSocketCommunicationSetup

        public SSLSocketCommunicationSetup(PartyData me,
                           PartyData party,
                           java.lang.String storePass)
                            throws DuplicatePartyException,
                                   javax.net.ssl.SSLException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Constructor that gets the data of both parties and the password to the keyStore and trustStore.
        Parameters:
        me - The data of the current application.
        party - The data of the other application.
        storePass - The password to the keyStore and trustStore
        Throws:
        DuplicatePartyException - In case both parties are the same.
        java.io.IOException - In case there is a problem with the key store or trust store file.
        javax.net.ssl.SSLException - In case there is a problem during the SSL protocol initialization.

      • SSLSocketCommunicationSetup

        public SSLSocketCommunicationSetup(PartyData me,
                           PartyData party,
                           java.lang.String keyStoreName,
                           java.lang.String trustStoreName,
                           java.lang.String storePass)
                            throws DuplicatePartyException,
                                   javax.net.ssl.SSLException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Constructor that gets the data of both parties, the keystore and truststore files names and the password to them.
        Parameters:
        me - The data of the current application.
        party - The data of the other application.
        keyStoreName - Name of the keystore file of this party.
        trustStoreName - Name of the truststore file of this party.
        storePass - The password to the keyStore and trustStore
        Throws:
        DuplicatePartyException - In case both parties are the same.
        java.io.IOException - In case there is a problem with the key store or trust store file.
        javax.net.ssl.SSLException - In case there is a problem during the SSL protocol initialization.
